docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Oct. 12.--The Federal forces continue to hold the rebels in check and are making advances into revolutionary strongholds, according to a communique issued today by the Federal Minister of Justice.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Oct. 12.--The Federal forces continue to hold the rebels in check and are making advances into revolutionary strongholds, according to a communique issued today by the Federal Minister of Justice.
docs.abstract: Fed and rebel armies on Sao Paulo-Parana border; both claim advances

headline.main: BRAZIL ARMIES MEET ON LONG BATTLE LINE; DISPUTE FIRST GAINS; Advanced Guards Clash in Sao Paulo State as the Forces Manoeuvre for Fight. BLOW LIKELY IN 48 HOURS Federals Appear on Defensive, but Both Claim Advances in Three Regions. SOUTHERN FRONT CRUCIAL Government Defeat Would Force Its Troops Back to the Defense of Rio de Janeiro. FEDERALS REPORT VICTORIES. Hint of Federal Drive. Little News of One Column. BRAZIL ARMIES MEET ON LONG BATTLELINE Decisive Moment at Hand.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: ARGENTINA KEEPS NET TITLE; Beats Chile in Doubles to Clinch South American Championship.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: RIVERA, Uruguay, Oct. 13.--The train carrying to the front President Getulio Vargas of the State of Rio Grande do Sul and his General Staff left Santa Maria at 5 o'clock this morning, having taken seventeen hours to make the journey from Porto Alegre, because of the large ...

headline.main: DR. VARGAS ANSWERS BRAZIL'S PRESIDENT; Rio Grande Leader Says Rebels Plan to Overthrow Him and Dissolve Congress. PROMISES TO HONOR DEBTS Revolutionists Would Respect All Government Contracts Prior to Oct. 3, He States.
